medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain started 30 hours ago, beginning as periumbilical, crampy in nature without radiation. Pain continued throughout the night and localized to the right lower quadrant by the afternoon. The nature of the pain changed from dull periumbilical cramps to sharp localized pain that does not radiate and is not associated with food or activity. Patient also reported a fever of 101.6 degrees Fahrenheit at home this afternoon. This is the first episode of this type of pain. No nausea, vomiting, or changes in bowel habits.
